With Shadow Wing stareing in his eyes Lunarpine fealt weakened. "I 
understand why you wanted to do it Wing, but it still would've been 
wrong". He stepped back, he needed to be honest with her, he couldn't 
do that controlled by her eyes. "I should have been more careful 
about what I said, I should've paid more attention to my surroundings 
and kept my thoughts to myself."

"You're trying to hard to make me happy, I'm not happy being happy, 
I'm only content when I'm killing something. The bot spun swinging 
his hand catching a large spider off it's web. "I'm not unhappy 
because there's not any wolves here, It bothers me that I know 
they're out there somewhere."

She asked about the fishing trip. "No thanks, Every time I leave the 
area it seems like I miss out on all the action." He turned back to 
face her, "If I was here Ramhorn might not be in there." (Pointing 
back towards the CR room.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> "Yes, still an owl.  Oh well, it could be worse. I could be a 
wolf." 
> she said and started to laugh. She stopped laughing and smiled.  
She 
> looked into his eyes and felt consumed by them.
> "Look, I just wanted to try to make you happy. That's all.  I 
wasn't 
> trying to cause a disaster," she said with a smirk on her face.
> "If you got any ideas  for things I could do to make you a happier 
> bot, let me know. OK?" she smiled a sweet smile.
> "Now, I'm heading out to the stream to go fishing, care to join?"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > 
> >   Lunarpine hears Shadow Wings entrance, what was it about those 
> two that
> > made  them get along one minute and fight like cats and dogs 
(owls 
> and dog
> > in this case. He stood up and aproached her "Hello Wing, still an 
> owl I
> > see", he knew she couldn't change without the DNA, but for lack 
of 
> better
> > tact he opened a dialogue with her.
> >
